title: Congratulations, Barrie Schwortz
post:
Hi Dan
If I’m not mistaken there were supposed to be two other one sessions at the conference, one on Mark Guscin’s work on the Sudarium of Oviedo, claiming that it proves Jesus survived the crufixion and the other going further, dwelling on why therefore Jesus went to India.
As you know, I wrote two articles on the topics:
https://www.academia.edu/7893085/The_Quest_for_Jesus_in_Shroud_research
and
https://www.academia.edu/11804110/Is_the_Sudarium_of_Oviedo_the_key_to_unraveling_the_mystery_of_the_Shroud_of_Turin
I am sure everyone would like to know the whole story.
Thanks.

title: Congratulations, Barrie Schwortz
post:
Dear Barry,
I and my family have always admired you and how you’ve made educating the world about The Holy Shroud your life’s work. But this, stepping up to the lectern in a huge Muslim Community to be on hand to answer their questions and avail yourself to them about This Sacred Relic  was truly amazing.  We applaud your courage and humility and how well you handled that historical opportunity.  What could be more important?
author: Maria Dian Therese
